item.title: Nadine add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "We live as we dream--alone...." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "I don't like work--no man does--but I like what is in the work--the chance to find yourself. Your own reality--for yourself not for others--what no other man can ever know. They can only see the mere show, and never can tell what it really means." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Conrad Joseph
item.description: "Facing it, always facing it, thatâ€™s the way to get through. Face it." -- Conrad Joseph

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Of all the inanimate objects, of all men's creations, books are the nearest to us for they contain our very thoughts, our ambitions, our indignations, our illusions, our fidelity to the truth, and our persistent leanings to error. But most of all they resemble us in their precious hold on life." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "The question is not how to get cured, but how to live." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "There is no credulity so eager and blind as the credulity of covetousness, which, in its universal extent, measures the moral misery and the intellectual destitution of mankind." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Government in general, any government anywhere, is a thing of exquisite comicality to a discerning mind." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Let others pride themselves about how many pages they have written; I'd rather boast about the ones I've read." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Nadine add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description:
"La plus belle des ruses du diable est de vous persuader qu'il n'existe pas."
(<i>"The devil's finest trick is to persuade you that he does not exist."</i>)" -- Charles Baudelaire
